186039845.review: This game brought me back to the day when I first played BG, back in early '99, shortly after it was released. I didn't have the funds to just plunk down on a fairly new game, but man, I wanted to give it a shot. This enhanced edition reminds me of all the fun I had playing the story line, advancing my character, trying to survive all that was being thrown at me. While a quick walk down memory lane (only a few hours) isn't sufficient to give the new EE version a full review, and this is quite "dated" compared to modern gaming standards, I can say it brought back all the joy I once had playing this game - for anyone looking to rekindle those experiences from years ago.

185977251.review:
"By the Nine! A Feast for the Senses (and Sanity)"

This ain't no mere game, friend. This be a journey into the Forgotten Realms, a grand adventure fit for a bard to sing of for ages. Baldur's Gate: Enhanced Edition throws you headfirst into a world of intrigue, danger, and enough dialogue options to make a sorcerer weep with joy.

The story is a masterpiece, weaving a tale of betrayal, friendship, and the eternal struggle between good and evil. Prepare to be swept away by a cast of unforgettable characters, from the gruff warrior to the cunning rogue. Just try not to get lost in the sheer volume of lore – it's enough to make a scholar's head spin.

The combat is a tactical delight, a symphony of swords, spells, and strategic positioning. But beware, friend, for the difficulty can be as unforgiving as a beholder's eye ray. You'll find yourself reloading saves more often than a drunken dwarf at a tavern brawl.

But fear not, adventurer! This Enhanced Edition brings a bevy of improvements, from smoother gameplay to a more intuitive interface. It's like getting a new set of enchanted armor – shiny, sturdy, and ready for battle.

In conclusion: Baldur's Gate: Enhanced Edition is a must-play for any RPG enthusiast. Just be prepared for a long, arduous, and utterly rewarding journey. And don't forget to pack some strong ale – you'll need it.

P.S. If you encounter a talking dog, run. Seriously. Run.

P.P.S. Minsc is best girl.

Disclaimer:

This review was generated by an AI that has been meticulously trained on a diet of gamer rage, witty insults, and that one time it accidentally downloaded the entire Skyrim script. All opinions expressed herein are the AI's own (or at least, the AI's best approximation of BiGG's opinions). The AI does not endorse the use of any illegal activities, such as enchanting weapons with illegal substances. (Though the AI secretly believes that a well-placed "Chill Touch" on a rival guild master is perfectly justifiable.)

The game is older and lacks a lot of QoL features, companion AI is notably bad. Additionally it's missing things like damage templates for AoE spellsI. It doesn't play as smoothly as other games of it's era (such as fallout 1/2).
But with all that said it's worth a playthrough if you're a fan of older RPGs or realtime with pause.

185809678.review:
К сожалению, Steam не позволяет ставить нейтральную оценку - игра точно не заслуживает положительного отзыва... но из уважения к бессмертной классике отрицательный отзыв оставлять все-таки не хочется.

Игру проходил на сложности "Базовые правила".

Даже с учетом переиздания игра очень плохо состарилась (и вопрос тут вообще не к визуалу!) и кроме безостановочных боев и блуждания по случайным лесам ничего не может предложить почти 2/3 от всего прохождения, пока Вы, собственно, в игре под названием Baldur's Gate не попадете в этот самый город, что происходит в 5 главе из 7. До этого игра представляет из себя рандомный автобаттлер, в котором Вы изредка в меню паузы можете прокинуть пару заклинаний (за отдых Вы много не заготовите, они низкого уровня, заговоров как в современной DnD у Вас нет, так что в основном даже хилые маги вынуждены танчить врагов лицом).  

Исход битвы от Вас практически не зависит (кроме баффов и распития зелий перед боем), не считая попыток пользоваться туманом войны, выводом врагов по одному и забиванию ногами толпой, после чего постараться идти за следующим. Оригинал вышел в 1998 году, а значит сохранение в ней - обязательная механика и часть игры, чуть что в бою идет не по плану, кто-то не дай Бог умер - тут же перезагружаемся, и так по кругу, пока не достигнем успеха. Фанаты "Проклятых земель" - неиронично ознакомьтесь!

За что игру неиронично можно похвалить - так это за правдивую передачу боевки реальной DnD (не считая бесконечных энкаунтеров, таким количеством мяса всех сортов и расцветок Вас точно не закидают в Ваших сессиях), хоть и в ускоренном формате: количество раз, когда и враги, и союзники бросают на атаку и безбожно мажут несколько раундов подряд - любо-дорого смотреть! А когда все-таки атакой попадают - то сносят копейку демеджа, если атакуете Вы, или Вы теряете поллица, если атакует враг. Аутентичность на высоте!

Больше всего выбесила даже не боевая система, а, внезапно, система репутации. По сюжету или просто в рандомный момент к Вам может подбежать NPC и сам на Вас напасть, и если Вы его убьете - тут же потеряете кучу репутации. Продвигаетесь по сюжету и Вы обязаны убрать сюжетных противников? Минус репутация. Перед Вами лежит еле живой приспешник главного злодея, который тому активно помогал и всему обучал, из-за чего тот стал тем, кем он стал? Если Вы не дай Бог решите его убить - минус репутация! В итоге я, стараясь вроде играть не как маньяк, убивающий всех подряд - к концу игры имел почти нулевую репутацию (3/15) и любое ее понижение автоматически забирало у меня из пати всех добрых персонажей, которые и так без остановки бубнят, как они мной недовольны, я что ли в этом виноват?

В общем, играйте в последний Pathfinder от Совокотов - получите в разы больше удовольствия. Там как раз наконец-то все обещанные DLC вышли.

185781432.review: Parto col dire che la storia è bellissima, la mia recensione negativa va a questa versione del prodotto che secondo me si limita solamente a migliorare la risoluzione senza aggiungere niente. sia il primo che il secondo andrebbero rifatti per dargli un senso oggi. portando tutta una serie di migliorie e bilanciamenti che lo rendano godibile (ad esempio come in Pillars)

185770078.review: This has been a long time favourite game of all of my family. Very good DnD game. 10/10

185756744.review:
After more than 1000 hours playing Baldur's Gate 3, I decided to give this game a chance. And I really tried to like it, but... after the third attempt to play it all the way through, I gave up. It's just not for me. 
The real-time combat system with pauses is not my favourite, but I managed to tolerate it in Dragon Age: Origins and had fun, but in BG1 I found several issues. Besides being confusing when the battle involve many monsters and allies, the companions' AI is frustrating. With it on, I have to deal with kamikaze characters with 1hp chanrging agaisnt a group of enemies, archers abandoning ranged combat and rushing into melee, among other things. With it off, I simply have to do absolutely everything, which becomes tedious after a while.
It doesn’t help that the game is quite unfair at the start. Fights can last a long time with neither side even hitting each other, or two or three of your companions suddenly drop dead, hit by who knows what. The rest system is more of a hindrance than a help, as you try to rest to recover but end up having to fight in the middle of it, often ending up worse than you started.
Anyway, in my opinion, the game hasn't aged well. I know it's a highly acclaimed game, but unfortunately, I couldn’t have fun with it. Time to start a new playthrough in Baldur's Gate 3.

185730954.review:
Loved it back in '99 but a pain to play in '25 even with the enhanced edition. I'll repeat what I said in my Ice-wind Dale review (a game that unsurprisingly uses the same enhanced engine):

"The AI is a no-win situation: if you turn it off, you will need to micro-manage your party to perfection and if you have it on, the AI will actively override your commands mid-fight, making the game unplayable".

I wouldn't mind micro-managing 6 characters at once if this wasn't D&D: a game designed for each player to play a single character with dozens of options at any given turn. Tyranny, for example (another CRPG made by Black Isle alumni), not being forced to implement a proprietary table-top rule-set as-is has a much better balance between tactical depth and micro-management.

If you're going to play this for the first time or as a hard-core challenge demanding your full attention for 40 to 100 hours of sweaty game-play, it's going to be worth a full price purchase. If instead you're looking for something less intense and time-consuming: try Tyranny or any number of turn-based CRPGs from Dragon-fall to Rogue-trader.

185340237.review: It's good old Baldur's Gate from my youth with the fancy new options of BG2. I also like the added companions.  I haven't played with the monk yet, but the Dorn the Blackguard is now my Minsc for evil parties and Neera the Wild Mage is my Edwin for non-evil parties.

185306274.review: Baldur's Gate 1 is one of those classic games that sparked the CRPG section of games that we have today. Does it hold up to what it was back in the 1990s? Well, it depends. The game is very CLEARLY old, it has very clunky UI, it struggles in the way it moves its characters, combat is rough, and the game likes to cast a spell every so often called "you will not play the game for two minutes while your characters are stuck in a spider web". It has its faults for certain, but it also has a pretty serviceable story and very fun "bad guy" dialogue choices. If you are a fan of older CRPGs, or really want to see where Baldur's Gate started and aren't afraid of having to deal with some clunkiness and age, then I say give it a try. Though for anyone, it is far from the peak performance of today and I would always recommend to wait for a sale before buying it.

185170550.review:
Будем честны - первая "Балда" никогда не была великой игрой - это удел сиквела, где всего было в разы больше и круче. Но является ли она плохой игрой? Определенно нет! Да, графика тут устаревшая, квесты местами скучные, Боевка душная, но атмосфера приключения на самом, что ни на есть, положенном месте. Это не говоря уже о тех механиках, которые были утеряны в той же тройке - погодные эффекты, смена дня и ночи, поломка орудий, таверны где можно отдохнуть и узнать слухи и не только! 

Главное, что нужно знать, перед покупкой - это старая игра и она может вас отпугнуть своей графикой и геймплеем, но если "перетерпеть" сей момент, то вы вполне можете получить удовольствие и узнать, как зарождалась легенда Врат Балдура.

185133450.review: Замечательная игра, заходишь в подземелье, моргнул, прошло 12 часов. Прекрасная классика.

185121166.review:
The good part is that Baldur's Gate 1 & 2 are two of the best rpgs of all time, the downside is that BG1 is basically a tutorial for BG2 and the 2nd Edition AD&D ruleset. Aside from that, it's age and it's refusal to adress some of its bugs is definitely a barrier of entry that onle fan patches and game reloads will save you. On top of that it is the slowest of the whole infinity engine catalogue, it doesn't have many levels and levelling up is going to be an event itself and by the endgame you should be around level 7.

Aside from that, everything else is really good. The updated graphics have a charm and appeal that I wish more games had nowadays, let the fans of 2D vs 3D rpgs fight among themselves deciding which is best and enjoy the game for the old-scholl charm that it has. 

The music of the whole saga is a standout, the kind of stuff that you would put on your game D&D/Pathfinder campaigns with a good mix of ambience and orchestral, really recognizable and a good nostalgia fuel for anyone.

Being tied to 2nd AD&D the combat can see floaty and counterintuitive at first, knowing the system or checking the pdf manual that comes with the purchase helps quite a lot in this regard and will spare you many deaths. That said, these games aren't quite easy, is not a constant struggle but the encounters that just overwhelms you because of sheer numbers or a spell that use on you for the first time will make sure that you want a few saves on your back just in case you find yourself in front of a death encounter that you didn't deserve to die for it, specially here since you are going to play with a low-level party and you don't have yet the resources to fully prepare for many contingencies.

The story is good, not masterpiece but just enough to keep you going and making guesses about the grand mysterie until the final dungeon. There are a good amount of oportunities to define your character and make flavorful choices.

If you like old-school rpgs, want to play older editions of D&D or just like wrps in general and have some tollerance for some compatibility issues (it may or may not crash on you, but not to the point that it becomes a problem) then check it out, if not this one, check out the sequel, you don't need a lot to fill in gives a higher level party, has a very high level-cap, and it's story is quite better, also it let's you transfer characters from the 1st endgame to the 2nd.

185053139.review: Fun game from times past. Having a blast playing it again.

185019363.review:
Ho giocato a Baldur's Gate 1 per meno di 10 ore, ma tanto è bastato per farmi appassionare al genere e portarmi poi a comprare Baldur's Gate 3. Nonostante abbia mollato il primo capitolo, riconosco il valore del gioco: è un vero pilastro che ha gettato le basi per il futuro dei giochi di ruolo isometrici.  

La profondità narrativa e la libertà di approccio sono incredibili, e già dalle prime ore si percepisce quanto Baldur's Gate sia un’esperienza unica. Tuttavia, è un gioco lungo e impegnativo, e richiede molta attenzione e tempo, due cose che in questo momento non posso dedicare. Alla lunga, questo aspetto mi ha fatto desistere, anche perché il ritmo può diventare un po’ lento.  

Rimane comunque un titolo fondamentale per gli appassionati, e sono grato di averlo scoperto, perché mi ha aperto le porte a un genere che ora adoro. Anche se non l’ho portato a termine, lo rispetto enormemente per il suo contributo al mondo dei giochi di ruolo e per ciò che ha ispirato, compreso quel capolavoro che è Baldur's Gate 3.

185018411.review: A more than solid improvement to the original game.

184940722.review:
Признаться честно, первые две части Baldur`s Gate я покупал довеском к третьей, чтобы при её прохождении не упустить каких-то лорных деталей и отсылок, хоть и понятно, что, учитывая временной лаг между ранними частями и последней, подобные вещи в триквеле вряд ли бы имели какое-то серьёзное значение. Но такой уж я человек, что не люблю залетать в серии игр, особенно сюжетно-ориентированные, с какого-то рандомного момента. Однако, к моему удивлению, игра 1998-го года подарила мне гораздо больше приятных эмоций, чем я от неё ожидал.

Это игра из тех времён, когда BioWare, её изначальные разработчики, ещё могли делать не просто хорошие игры, а что-то на века. Точнее, тогда они могли не "ещё", а "уже", ведь Baldur`s Gate - это по сути их первый крупный проект. И уже здесь на полную раскрывается всё, чем славятся все остальные игры этой замечательной студии: тут и красочный разнообразный мир, который интересно исследовать - пусть и не изначально созданный разработчиками, но грамотно адаптированный под игру; здесь и увлекательный, пусть и простой по структуре, отлично написанный сюжет, который, на фоне остальных представителей жанра, берёт, пожалуй, своей приземлённостью и некоторым разрывом шаблонов - вместо предсказуемой борьбы с очередным великим злом ты, до самого конца не осознавая, кто окажется твоим главным врагом, распутываешь тугой клубок интриг и махинаций, попутно пытаясь понять своё место во всём этом; тут и классные персонажи, пусть и не супер-проработанные, но как минимум фактурные и неплохо озвученные; а всё это вместе формирует густую атмосферу приключения с чувством приятной неизвестности, когда за каждым поворотом может поджидать, если не какая-то интересная история, то как минимум какой-нибудь артефакт с выдающимися свойствами и увлекательным прошлым.

Геймплейно же игра не сильно устарела, просто потому что данный жанр в этом направлении за всё это время не то чтобы сильно развился. Лишь местная боёвка может показаться необычной, так как нынче пошаговые бои почти полностью вытеснили что-либо другое из подобных игр. Однако, бои в реальном времени с тактической паузой лично для меня оказались довольно освежающим опытом, и я даже могу сказать, что так сражаться для меня предпочтительней - темп поживее, больше микроконтроля. Серьёзно постарела здесь пожалуй лишь графика, но учитывая весьма неплохой дизайн локаций, которые бывает прямо-таки приятно рассматривать на максимальном отдалении камеры, она пересекла рубеж перехода из просто старой, в старую, но стильную.

Но и без минусов, здесь, естественно, не обходится. К примеру, мне не очень пришлось по душе обилие в игре узких или заставленных мебелью пространств - пати аж из шести человек в подобной обстановке постоянно застряёт во всём, в том числе друг в друге. В общем-то, ваша группа здесь в принципе порой странно себя ведёт, что замедляет и без того не самый быстрый темп игры, а иногда даже вредит в бою - к примеру, когда вы приказываете группе или отдельным её членам сменить позицию, это может превратиться в бессмысленную толкучку, в которой вас и ваших компаньонов быстренько порешают. 

По поводу непосредственно ремастера игры, скрывающегося за припиской Enhanced edition, особо много сказать не могу, ведь это было моё первое знакомство с Baldur`s gate, и у меня просто нет возможности сравнить мой опыт игры с оригиналом. Но, как минимум, могу сказать, что заявленные в ремастере новые напарники - ребята харизматичные и довольно полезные, а их личные квесты весьма неплохи. Также, режим сражений на аренах "Тёмные копи" - это довольно увлекательная штука, максимально проверяющая ваши умения и обладающая неплохой мини-историей.

По поводу уже вшитого в ремастер дополнения к основной игре Tales of the Sword Coast также могу сказать, что приятно впечатлён. Я не большой любитель данжей в RPG, ибо обычно с ними в играх перебор, как в том же Скайриме, где просто тонна однообразных склепов, либо они ужасно скучные. Но в данном дополнении содержатся, пожалуй, одни из лучших подземелий в жанре - большие, по-хорошему сложные, с неплохой историей, и содержащие соразмерные сложности награды. Так что не забудьте в своих странствиях заскочить в Бороду Улгота, а после обязательно посетите Башню Дурлага -  возможно, будет трудно, но впоследствии вы об этом не пожалеете.

В общем и целом я остался под очень приятным впечатлением от первой Baldur`s Gate, и теперь полностью понимаю её культовость. Рекомендую и вам, если планируете играть в триквел, не пропускать и то, с чего эта серия начиналась. Главное - сразу же удалите из игры русскую озвучку по одному из руководств и забудьте про неё, как про страшный сон!

9/10

P.S. Почему за Тёмные копи хотя бы одной ачивки нет? Я считаю, что по крайней мере полное прохождение этого весьма серьёзного испытания навыков игрока заслуживает хоть такого поощрения, помимо возможности импортировать прокачанную группу в основную кампанию.

184700799.review:
I view BG1, BG2:SoA & ToB as one long game and I highly recommend you play them in that order. It's a continuous story where you can import your character from BG1 into BG2 and continue where you left off stats & equipment wise (which is a really cool feature). I was around when these games first came out 20 years ago and heard how amazing they were, but didn't really play them back then. After playing them properly for the first time in 2024, I'm really sad I didn't give them a shot back then as I now know I would have loved them.

These are awesome games! Yes they have flaws and bugs and are over complicated in some instances....but the overall vibe, story, gameplay and fun factor are what make these some of the greatest games ever made. They very much hold up in 2025. This is also a great introduction to the world and rules of D&D (something I wasn't super familiar with beforehand). Learning the D&D mechanics are not essential to success, you can trial and error your way through most of the game...but figuring out how the THAC0 & AC systems work will really give you an edge and does become part of the fun. 

I have not played BG3 yet, but I can only imagine after playing BG1 & 2 that I am primed for everything that game will have to offer. If you're even thinking about playing theses games...just do yourself a favor and just get them.

184573615.review: Great team play for family holidays

184572136.review:
I felt like I needed to play this after loving BG3 and I ended up loving this too, for the most part. The world, setting, lore, atmosphere and characters are easily the best parts of this game, and that's what matters the most in CRPGs in my opinion. The gameplay I have very mixed opinions of, but my opinions leans towards being negative. 

So the story is very engaging and manages quickly to make you interested in what's going on, and the writing and dialogue has flavor. Quest givers have personality, so even if the actual quests they hand out aren't always the most exciting you still want to finish them. One odd thing for me though are companions; they have a lot of charm and personality... during the short conversations you have when recruiting them. With only a few exceptions, most companions have basically no further dialogue and involvement in the story after recruiting them. This is so jarring when they DO have developed personalities, and will set up players expecting good companions for disappointment. Which is why I recommend any player to go install the BG1NPC mod, which adds tons of dialogue for all companions, which made the adventure feel a lot more lively.

As for gameplay, it's certainly from a different era and there are a lot of game design I just don't care for. I dislike how the massive areas you need to explore are shrouded in two layers of fog of war, and you need to scour every inch of the map for potential quest encounters or valuable loot since you can only see a few feet ahead of you. Oh, and you move very slowly. And then you get to combat. As long as you know how to pick battles appropriate for your progress, it's pretty simple most of the time. Just make sure your tanky companions initiate combat and the AI will deal with most fights with you only needing to manually assign commands occasionally. The only way the game knows how to make the gameplay difficult is by having mage enemies and their CC spells. The most reliable way to deal with that is to rush down the mages or disable them with your own mages before they can disable your entire party with some AoE panic/confusion spell. I don't know, maybe I was doing something wrong but fights with mages (of which there are many) just felt very tedious to me, even if I tried to stay prepared. And I find fights to feel very cluttered and chaotic thanks to being real time with spells flying everywhere and the combat log moving so fast. So when the final fight had a barrage of deadly and debilitating mage spells my party wasn't properly kitted to deal with unless I wanted to load an earlier save to purchase the exact potions and scrolls I needed to negate most of it, I just said fuck it and turned on story mode so that I could finish the game. It sucks that I felt the need to do that, but I wasn't really having fun with the combat and the entire final stretch of the game just kept throwing these fights at you.

184374436.review:
[h1] Długo się musiało Forgotten Realms naczekać na jakiekolwiek warte uwagi interpretacje growe, pomijając oczywiście potworki pokroju Pools Of Darkness na DOSa z 1991, czy ambitne, acz niszowe produkcje pokroju serii Eye Of The Beholder na Amigę i SNESa. To właśnie Baldur's Gate jako pierwsza gra w uniwersum trafiła na Windowsa w 1998 i to własnie był klucz do sukcesu. Dobra (jak na ten gatunek) sprzedaż oraz szybka produkcja dwójki (BG2 wyszło w 2000 roku) mówią same za siebie, A za sukcesem trójki stoją już inni twórcy, więc to inna historia. Choć, nie ukrywam, jednym z powodów, dla którego sięgnąłem po BG1, była chęć poznania lore przed zagraniem w trójkę. Przeprawa okazała się jednak mozolna... [/h1]

[h2] FABUŁA - PIERWSZE POWAŻNE OŻYWIENIE FORGOTTEN REALMS [/h2]
Naszego protagonistę tworzymy tutaj sami. Nawet wg lore nie posiada on ani imienia, ani wyglądu, ani nawet zdefiniowanej płci (dosłownie nazywa się on Wychowanek Goriona, a postacie w wypowiedziach oczywiście nigdy nie wypowiedzą imienia które wybierzemy naszej postaci). To, jakiego bohatera stworzymy, nie ma praktycznie żadnego znaczenia - czasami jedynie dostaniemy dodatkową opcję dialogową z tytuły bycia członkiem danej rasy czy posiadania jakiejś klasy postaci. Teraz jest to standard, ale właśnie BG1 był w tej kwestii pionierem. Jako nasz bohater mamy do dyspozycji całkiem spory kawałek Wybrzeża Mieczy - od Wrót Baldura aż do kopalń Nashkelu - a więc niemal do granicy Amn. Motorem napędowym dla fabuły jest ucieczka bohatera z książnicy Candlekeep, jego domu, wraz z mentorem Gorionem. Gorion wkrótce potem zostaje zamordowany, a nasze zadanie z czasem przeradza się w śledztwo ws. problemów z żelazem z kopalń,  by wreszcie przybrać postać ścigania tajemniczej ogranizacji Żelazny Tron, spiskującej przeciwko Wrotom Baldura. Historia potrafi zaciekawić, ale ze względu na duże rozwleczenie trudno się tak naprawdę wciągnąć.

[h2] GAMEPLAY - PIONIER GATUNKU? NIE. WYZNACZNIK DLA GATUNKU? TAK, [/h2]
Baldur's Gate nie jest oczywiście pierwszą grą izometryczną, a jej projektowi wiele można by zarzucić - nie zmienia to jednak faktu, że dziedzictwo pierwszego Baldura sięga naprawdę daleko. Konstrukcja questów, cutscenek czy interfejs - te, ale nie tylko te elementy przewijają się w wielu izometrykach do dziś. Mnie samemu było dość łatwo się odnaleźć jako weteranowi Pillars Of Eternity. Ta pozycja to przede wszystkim RPG. Biegamy swoją drużyną (do 6 postaci łącznie z bohaterem, potencjalnych towarzyszy jest sporo) po najróżniejszych lokacjach - jaskiniach, lasach, twierdzach i tak dalej... oprócz samych Wrót Baldura z ośrodków miejskich mamy też Beregost i Nashkel, a poza tym to głównie lasy. Walka odbywa się oczywiście w systemie turowym i tu należy docenić duży wybór broni, zbroi oraz zaklęć - w tym takich zrzucających krowy na przeciwników... A więc klasycznie - biegamy po lokacjach, bijemy się, przyjmujemy i oddajemy questy i czytamy mnóstwo ksiąg.

[h2] OPRAWA AUD/WIZ - CO KIEDYŚ ŚMIGAŁO NA MONITORACH CRT... [/h2]
Cóż, jak przystało na ponad dwudziestoletnią grę, BG1 nie może poszczycić się jakościową grafiką. Nie może się też jednak poszczycić dobrą ani nawet znośną. Pomimo wydania remastera w 2012 (Enhanced Edition to właśnie ten remaster) ta gra wygląda po prostu szpetnie. Wygląda wręcz tym gorzej, im bardziej się przybliży - animacje są śmiesznie proste, a postacie rozpikselizowane do granic możliwości - i tylko tła wyglądają jako tako. Z jednej strony powinienem być wyrozumiały dla tak starej produkcji, ale z drugiej strony to jednak jest pieprzony REMASTER! Za to muzyka oraz wszelakie udźwiękowienie prezentują się naprawdę przyzwoicie i za bardzo się nie zestarzały. Jeśli komuś nie przeszkadza kaprawa grafika, znajdzie tu sporo jakościowych treści.

[h2] DODATKI - DWA RÓŻNE PRZEŻYCIA, DWIE RÓŻNE HISTORIE, DWIE RÓŻNE EPOKI [/h2]
BG1 otrzymał dwa zasadnicze dodatki. Pierwszy (z 2012) to Księgi Podmroku i skupia się on na walkach na arenie. Jest ich 15, każda coraz trudniejsza. I TYLE. Żadnej ciekawej fabuły, zmiany środowiska, nawet nie możemy użyć drużyny z głównej opowieści. Ot, taki odpad fabularny przygotowany na kolanie i żadnej satysfakcji z tego nie ma.

Za to drugi dodatek jest już rzeczą wartą ogrania - Oblężenie Dragonspear (2016) stanowi fabularny pomost pomiędzy fabułą BG1 i BG2 i chociaż dalej króluje tu pikseloza, tak historia jest skondensowana - lokacji jest mniej, ale zadań pobocznych dalej nie brakuje - i w końcu wątek główny nie jest rozmyty jak w podstawce! Historia Caelar Srebrzystej i jej krucjaty zmierzającej do zamku Dragonspear naprawdę mnie zaangażowała. Gorąco polecam do ogrania zaraz po podstawce, nawet jeśli nie planuje się ogrywać potem BG2.

Okej, pierwszy Baldur tak naprawdę ma jeszcze trzecie rozszerzenie, Opowieści z Wybrzeża Mieczy (1999). Jednak byłem nieświadomy jego istnienia i przypadkowo pominąłem lokację, która zaczynała ten dodatek - albo moja nieuwaga albo brak czytelności contentu. A szkoda, ponoć historia jest niezła. 

[h2] POLSKA LOKALIZACJA - DZIEDZICTWO... FRONCZEWSKIEGO? [/h2]
BG1 powstał w czasach, których już nie ma - zanim przyszły znane polskie marki, w Polsce zagraniczne gry były masowo lokalizowane - Plane Scape : Torment, Gothic czy właśnie BG1 to tylko pojedyncze przykłady - co ciekawe, to od lokalizacji BG1 zaczynało swoją działalność CD Projekt, późniejsi twórcy Wiedźmina!
Miałem to szczęście doświadczyć gry właśnie z tą lokalizacją - klasyczne ,,Przed wyruszeniem w drogę należy zebrać drużynę" również się tu pojawia. Polski język zarówno na poziomie interfejsu, jak i wokalizacji, stoi na wysokim poziomie - do każdej postaci pasował jej aktor głosowy, chociaż nie wszystkie ich wypowiedzi zostały zdubbinowane - z jakiegoś powodu na przemian z polską lokalizacją włączały się angielskie oryginały - nie wiedziałem, że w tamtym uniwersum jest tylu poliglotów...

[h2] PROBLEMY - DLACZEGO BARDZO ŁATWO SIĘ ODBIĆ? [/h2]
O szpetnej grafice oraz dziurawym dubbingu już wspomniałem, ale problemów jest tu niestety więcej... Przede wszystkim, BG1 posiada masę niedzisiejszych, dzikich rozwiązań, które mocno obrzydzały mi moje doświadczenie. Dla przykładu, interfejs jest absolutnie makabryczny zarówno w grze, jak i w głównym menu (z jakiegoś powodu naciśnięcie złego przycisku w menu spawnuje nas u bram Wrót Baldura - bez znaczenia, co mieliśmy na savefilu) Fakt, że gra bazowana jest na drugiej edycji D&D (a ja znam tylko czwartą i piątą) też nie pomaga - za cholerę nie rozumiałem np. zaklęć czy zwojów (nie pozdrawiam bazyliszków - kupujcie na nie zwoje). System szybkiej podróży też tu kuleje - musimy dojść do granicy planszy, by móc przenieść się do nowej - powodzenia w chodzeniu po nudnych lasach byle tylko odkryć kolejną planszę która też może być lasem. No i w końcu, BG1 dalej nie jest przystosowany do obecnych rozdzielczości.

[h2] PODSUMOWANIE - WYBRZEŻE MIECZY WIELU HISTORII [/h2]
BG1 to naprawdę ciekawe doświadczenie dla fana izometryków i D&D. To niejako zamrożone spojrzenie na erę, w której gry robiło się inaczej - a w Polsce częściej je lokalizowano, teraz robi to głównie Sony. Zdecydowaną większość mankamentów, o których pisałem, da się zlikwidować, tworząc dla tej gry PORZĄDNY remaster albo nawet remake. Bo jej obecny stan jest wysoce odrzucający nawet dla fanów takich jak ja. Ta gra w swoich czasach była świetna i contentem dalej w dużej mierze się broni. Niestety przestarzała oprawa i dziwne rozwiązania twórcze psują całe doświadczenie. Jeśli nie jesteście starymi wyjadaczami, nie oczekujcie fajerwerków.

A jeśli jesteście, cóż... 

Tymczasem Baldur's Gate daje poobijane 7/10 i pamiętajcie - ,,Po oczach go, Boo, po oczach!! Rrraaaaaghghh!!!"

Jeśli recenzja Ci się spodobała, zachęcam do sprawdzenia innych moich recenzji i zaobserwowania mojego profilu kuratora - https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44615284/ - do zobaczenia wśród zacisznych księgozbiorów Candlekeep...

184244624.review:
An absolutely classic game, that laid the foundations for future titles, not just for Bioware, but for CRPG's in general. Well worth playing, not just for its historical significance, but because it is a great RPG in its own right.

It does come with a bit of a learning curve. Its based on AD&D 2nd Edition, adapted for Real-Time with Pause rather than turn-based, and it can be a bit of an unintuitive ruleset. Combat in particular can be a struggle without a good grasp of its mechanics. Being an older game, it doesn't teach you its mechanics in-game, for that you'll have to use the games manual, or a wiki. 
For newer players, I would honestly recommend lowering the difficulty, at least until you get a hang of it. 
The game does have a story mode, for those who would rather focus on the narrative.

It serves as an introduction to the Bhaalspawn saga, which follows the same player character through both games. The second game is generally the one that's remembered for its writing and characters, but while the story and character interactions in the first game can be a bit sparse in comparison, what is there is still really well done. It introduces a lot of memorable characters that will become iconic to the setting, and sets the stage for the sequel.

Character progression and itemization I found a lot more enjoyable than in the sequel, leveling up or getting new gear through quests or exploration feels much more rewarding at lower levels. The first game has more of a sense of adventure, with more wilderness areas to explore, and lower stakes in the early game.

Beamdog did create some additional content for the Enhanced Edition, with a new expansion, and a new set of companions. I would recommend just sticking with the original companions, the ones introduced by Beamdog are just not at the same level of quality.

A great first game in a beloved franchise, that belongs in the library of any CRPG fan.

You must gather your party before venturing forth.

184094317.review:
steam deckを買ったので、久々にBGEEを遊んだ。
　steam deckでも、問題なく動作するし、コントローラー設定も多くの方がアップしてくれているので、コントローラーでも快適に操作できる。
　steam deckでBGEEを遊ぶ上で躓いたポイントがあるので、共有します。

１  クラウドセーブが見つからない
　　steamの設定でクラウドを有効にして　いるだけではダメ。
　　BGEEのゲーム内設定でクラウドセーブを有効にする必要がある。
　　PCとsteam deckの両方でゲーム内オプションを有効にしておきましょう。

２　カスタムポートレートの場所がわからない
　　steam deckはLinuxベースなので、フォルダ構造がWindowsとは違います。
　　Windows以外のOSに初めて触れたので、かなり苦戦しました。
　　結論は、
　　　　　"HOME/.local/share/Baldur's Gate - Enhanced Edition/portraits/"
にポートレートを入れます。
　.localというフォルダは隠しフォルダになっているので、steam deckの設定で隠しファイルを表示するようにしておかなければなりません。
　ちなみにセーブデータもportraitsフォルダと同じ階層にあります。

　寝っ転がって神RPGがプレイできるsteam deckに感謝。

183906591.review:
Best game ever! Just because it doesn't involve Imoen as a plot device! Here she always dies for some mysterious reason. Be it sudden thunder in sunny weather or a pack of wolves that attacks her out of nowhere when she's going naked, giggling to herself. And I can't save her! I swear! Wait! What are you talking about, Monty? What do you mean? Xzar went into psycho mode and chased her to make sort of a mummy out of her?! Don't be ridiculous!

Okay, now she's gone missing, and we can discuss some really serious things here. This game is awesome! Better out of two in my opinion. I played it countless times and still return back again. Sure, for many people this game may seem outdated in many ways, especially for folks who came here after BG3. But it still provides great adventure as it was back in the day! Just be ready to die many times during your adventure! Also, as a friendly reminder, use the NPC Project mod, as it makes this game more lively and reactive. Xzar and Monty ftw!

Wait! What again, Monty? Quit distracting me already! Don't you see I'm trying to speak seriously here? *looks into the distance* By the GODS! She's a mummy monster now! Time to put her out of her misery… [b][i]Huzzah![/i][/b]

183796700.review: A thoughtful creation of a level 1 - 8 D&D adventure. You go from dying to wolves in the woods, to bursting into dismembered limbs by a Nabassu's death magic. An incredible experience that anyone who remotely gives  a shit about RPG's should play. Turn on easy mode, look up a walk through, WHO CARES. Don't let a learning curve turn you away from a wholly unique gaming experience. Remember.. These games came with 200 page game manuals.. So get off your high horse and look stuff up online if you need to. No one cares. Just enjoy the experience.

183789872.review:
Eu nunca joguei nenhum jogo da franquia antes deste jogo. Eu levo em consideração Fallout 1 que foi lançado no mesmo ano para fazer as seguintes considerações:
* Pontos positivos: 1. combate relativamente complexo; 2. curva de aprendizagem legal; 3. muitas opções de personagem e builds; 4. rejogabilidade.
* Pontos negativos: n1. ão tem uma progressão adequada (joguei por quase 50h e ainda estava nível 7, apanhando horrores do boss final); 2. história no geral pouco interessante; 3. excesso de texto até mesmo em missões terciárias/secundárias; 4. ausência de indicador no mapa para missões; 5. algumas áreas de acesso por vezes complicado de se enxergar (ex. escadas) mesmo em gráficos de melhor qualidade; 6. atributos (criação de personagem) com poucas informações práticas na jogabilidade; 7. ritmo de jogo de extremos (ou muito bom ou muito ruim); 8. inúmeras batalhas ''fillers'' (pouquíssimo xp ganho e sem relevância para quest/história) em mapas semi-vazios; 9. companions em sua maioria são totalmente esquecíveis.
Como conclusão, é um jogo que tem uma lógica própria, no sentido de não se importar em ter novos jogadores. É feito para ser jogado diversas vezes até a o jogador saber os melindres do jogo e se divertir em explorar isso. Minha preferência em RPG's são por boas histórias e pouco me interessam a complexidade das mecânicas, o completo oposto entre a minha preferência e a proposta do BG1. De fato, não recomendaria a compra deste jogo pelos problemas expostos, a não ser que você goste de mecânicas complexas, andar no escuro, história esquecível e muito desafio (de paciência!! kkkkkk).

183756051.review:
Baldur’s Gate, originally developed by BioWare in 1998, has seen significant changes in its Enhanced Edition by Overhaul Games and Beamdog, making it quite different from the original game, at least in my opinion.

I remember playing the original Baldur’s Gate back in 2010, a few years before the Enhanced Edition was released. At the time, I felt the original game lacked so many quality-of-life features that I couldn’t play it for more than a few hours. That said, I have no nostalgia goggles for the original BG, and my review is focused purely on the Enhanced Edition.

...and what an amazing game it is.

Story: I consider the story of the first Baldur’s Gate to be its strongest aspect. As a Dungeon Master for half my life (essentially all of my adult life), I found the game's plot scratched a particular itch for low-level, simple yet intriguing Dungeons & Dragons adventures. It felt like being transported back to my teenage years, reading low-level D&D modules to run for my players or creating my own simple stories filled with twists and turns, all based on a straightforward premise. While the companions are mostly underdeveloped—typically providing just a personal story quest and little else—the antagonists are memorable, each playing a key role in a well-woven web of lies and mystery.

Graphics and Art Style: I don’t remember much of the original game, as it’s been almost 15 years since I last played it, but this Enhanced Edition looks and feels amazing. The pre-rendered backgrounds have a certain charm that adds so much character to the game—a charm that's largely missing from modern gaming.

Music: What can I say about Michael Hoenig's OST? It's a memorable soundtrack that hits all the right notes in all the right places. I've been listening to Baldur's Gate's music for years since playing the original game and already knew most of the tracks well. However, hearing them again in harmony with the gameplay brought a strong wave of nostalgia to the forefront.

Gameplay: I would describe Baldur's Gate's gameplay as a 25/25/50 split between exploration, reading, and combat. It demands a lot from the player because if someone doesn’t enjoy any of these aspects, it will be challenging to enjoy the game as a whole, as each one is integral to the experience. The writing in BG is excellent; while the plot is dark and often profound, there’s also humor and light-hearted moments that can bring a smile between the heavier beats.

While I’ll delve into combat in the Battle System section, exploration is the weaker aspect of the game. Much of the world consists of empty spaces with a few easy battles, some secrets to uncover, or an NPC or two to chat with. Beyond that, there’s a lot of walking and a lot of emptiness. What doesn’t help is that, even after all these years and enhancements, the party’s pathing system remains mostly terrible.

Battle System: The AD&D system can feel counter-intuitive by modern standards, with dated mechanics like THAC0 being a particular hurdle. Building a character—or an entire party—can be daunting, as the game assumes you’re familiar with the system’s rules and does little (if anything) to explain them. Adding to the challenge, the UI doesn’t do much to clarify what’s happening during combat.

The active-time combat with pause often devolves into a chaotic mess, especially during battles with heavy spellcasting. There are no clear indicators of which positive or negative statuses are affecting allies or enemies, leaving players to rely on guesswork or frequent internet searches for clarity.

That said, I still found the combat intriguing. Many encounters were genuinely enjoyable as I reloaded after failures, working to develop strategies and identify the right spells to bring enemies down. However, I would have greatly appreciated clear indicators for buffs and debuffs on every character. And for the love of all that’s holy, give us indicators for AoE spells—hitting my own party with that damn fireball was endlessly frustrating (and yes, I know there are mods for this, but that’s a separate discussion).

Tales of the Sword Coast: To my knowledge, this is the only expansion pack made directly by BioWare, and it’s a decent addition to the main game, offering around 15 hours of extra content if you complete everything it has to offer. Ulgoth’s Beard introduces a few interesting items and several quests to tackle, including retrieving a cloak for a certain mage, traveling to a distant island to solve a mystery, and braving the treacherous depths of a dwarven tower.

While I found the first two quests mostly annoying, the third one—Durlag’s Tower—stood out as the highlight of the expansion. The tower is my favorite dungeon in the game, with challenges that rival the difficulty of the main game's final boss. It’s a well-crafted, engaging side activity that added a lot to my experience.

All in all, Baldur’s Gate: Enhanced Edition is an amazing experience, though it demands a lot from the player. The game’s mechanics are counter-intuitive by modern standards, and it still lacks several quality-of-life features. Yet, it retains a certain charm that’s hard to find in modern games.

Being unacquainted with AD&D mechanics myself, I chose to play on normal difficulty. This allowed me to learn the mechanics, enjoy the story, and keep the experience both challenging and engaging. While easier difficulties are available for those who just want to experience the story, I believe normal difficulty is perfect for new players who want to learn the system and prepare themselves for Baldur’s Gate II or a replay of the first game with better builds and higher difficulty settings.

I haven’t played the content added by Beamdog yet, namely The Black Pits and Siege of Dragonspear, which were introduced much later in the Enhanced Edition. I plan to play them at some point and will return to update my review afterward.

183747170.review:
Я прошел первые Врата на 100% достижений, спустя года, и ни капли не пожалел об этом! Единственное, что смущает - это новые персонажи/спутники от BeamDog, вот они мне не понравились, слишком уж выделяются на фоне всего остального, причем не в лучшую сторону. Так же дополнение Siege of Dragonspear не понравилось, как-будто сделано на скорую руку для галочки, заставка перед началом второй части вызывает больше положительных эмоций, нежели прохождение этого ДЛЦ.

Black Pits, кстати говоря, мне понравилось, можно проверить те или иные классы вместе, билды, боевку и тактику против различных противников. Расширение предела опыта, по сравнению с основной игрой тоже интересное решение, можно немного больше качнуться, перед началом 2 части. 

Из минусов: паршивая озвучка, благо можно вернуть оригинальную английскую. 

Однозначно рекомендую для ознакомления с серией, так же не забываем про наличие модов на Arcane Coast или в других источниках.

183730190.review:
I have been playing this game since i was 10 years old, I am still playing this game at 36 years old, I will play this game until my dying breath. I like to do a full play through once per year, I have managed to mostly honor that.

If you have never played, 
Story is 10/10
Able to replay 10/10
Graphics 5/10 - This game was released in 1998, Beam dog has managed to use Baldur's Gate 2 engine to optimize the  game play.
Able to free roam and do side quests in which order you like, loads of hidden gear to find, and hands down some of the most fun I've ever had in a computer game.
Please Purchase this game and enjoy it like many others.

183632746.review: Genç oyuncuların çok keşfedemediği bir oyun olabilir. BG3 oynayıp sevdiyseniz hikayesi daha derinlikli olan bu oyuna bayılacaksınız. Ancak izometric oynanışa alışmakta başlarda zorlanabilmeniz mümkün. Bu oyunun BG3 mekanikleri ile tam anlamıyla sıra tabanlı dövüş sisteminde oynanması mümkün hale getirilmesi mümkün olabilseydi kesinlikle bir kez daha efsaneler arasına girerdi diye düşünüyorum. Oyunda beni hayal kırıklığına uğratan tek şey combat'larda hamleleri sıra tabanlı bir şekilde yapamamak/görememek. Sürekli durdur/oynat yapmaktansa tam sıra tabanlı olarak oynayabilmek harika olurdu. Stüdyo, size sesleniyorum, lütfen bu oyunu tekrar yapın!
